proposals.reasoning: This team lines up with several independently suggested combinations (notably from Henry, Iris, and Jack), which reduces the sense that I’m forcing a pocket of consensus around Bob and Diana. It includes only one of the early ‘default core’ names (none, actually, since it avoids both Bob and Diana), which addresses concerns about giving evil an easy hideout in an auto-approved pair. Grace and Henry are both being framed as good info-generating picks with no strong suspicion yet, and adding Iris keeps the composition in line with the widely discussed Grace–Henry–Iris setup. Overall, this should be easier for the table to evaluate and approve, while giving us a clean baseline read from Mission 1 without overly committing to any early-game narrative.

votes.comment: I want at least one evil (Iris) on the first mission for an early sabotage opportunity and information.
Too many members from the anti-Bob/Diana bloc (Grace, Henry, Iris); feels like a coordinated pocket where multiple evils could be hiding.
Too many players who’ve been pushed as a package deal; I’d rather see at least one of Bob/Diana/Frank on M1 for a clearer comparison instead of a fully ‘alternative’ trio.
Early mission with no info yet; high chance at least one evil is included among three players, so I’m fine letting this go for information.
My evil teammate Iris is on the team, so I want this to go through for potential sabotage and info.
Avoids the Bob+Diana consensus pocket I was worried about and matches multiple independent suggestions; reasonable info-gathering Mission 1 team.
I’m on it and multiple players independently backed this trio over the Bob+Diana core, so it’s a reasonable, low-bias info team for Mission 1.
This matches the info-first spread I advocated (avoiding the Bob+Diana core) and gives a clean baseline read without clustering consensus picks.
Consistent with my earlier support for Grace–Henry–Iris and avoids the Bob+Diana consensus core, giving good info while I’m on the team to help shape reads.
Team avoids the early Bob+Diana consensus pocket and includes one of my Merlin/Morgana candidates, which is acceptable info-wise for Mission 1.

discussion.content: For the first mission we should keep it simple and go with people who tend to play cautiously—something like Bob, Diana, and Frank feels reasonably safe. I’m more wary of tossing newer or quieter players straight onto Mission 1, since it’s easy for evil to hide there.
I’m fine being on the first team, but I’d rather mix it up a bit—maybe Bob, Diana, and Grace, so we’re not just defaulting to Frank without any real reason yet.

I’d rather avoid putting both early proposers on or near the same team right away, so something like Bob, Frank, and Grace feels like a cleaner info-gathering start. If we keep the first mission low-drama and low-risk, it’ll be easier to read reactions afterward.

I like the idea of mixing it up a bit rather than defaulting to “safe” picks, so Bob–Diana–Grace seems like a reasonable starting point. It gives us some info without clustering too many vocal players together right away.
I’d rather avoid piling too much consensus on Grace this early, so something like Bob–Diana–Eve feels like a cleaner first team that still gives us decent info without overcommitting to any one read.

I don’t love how fast everyone’s consolidating around Bob + Diana plus a rotating third—feels like an easy place for evil to hide. I’d rather see at most one of Bob/Diana on the first team, paired with two people who haven’t been pre-cleared by half the table yet, like Grace and maybe Henry or Iris.

I’m a bit uneasy with how locked-in Bob + Diana are already; I’d rather start with just one of them plus two less-discussed players, like Grace–Henry–Bob or Grace–Iris–Diana, so we’re not giving an early pocket for evil to hide in consensus.

I don’t love how quickly Bob + Diana became the default core, so for an info-first Mission 1 I’d rather see a team like Grace–Henry–Iris or Grace–Henry–Bob, with only one of the “consensus” picks on it. That spreads risk a bit and gives us clearer reactions if something goes wrong.

I’m more in line with Henry here: I’d rather see a Grace–Henry–Iris team for Mission 1 so we’re not locking in both Bob and Diana as a default core this early. That spreads the risk and gives us cleaner info if anything goes wrong.

I’m also not loving how quickly Bob+Diana became the default core, so I’d lean toward a spread like Grace–Henry–Iris or Grace–Henry–Bob for Mission 1 to avoid giving a comfy consensus pocket for evil right away.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1’s clean result makes it likely (though not certain) that Grace and Henry are good, so I want to preserve most of that info without fully locking in the Grace/Henry/Iris trio again. Including myself adds one more person I know is good, and bringing in Diana fits with the idea of keeping two from the original team and rotating one slot for better information. This avoids repeating the exact same block that several players were very eager to entrench, while still leaning on our best data from Mission 1 and expanding our read on a new player.

votes.comment: I’d rather keep the full Grace/Henry/Iris core from the clean first mission instead of swapping Iris out this early, since rotating only one member gives less clear info on what changed.
Includes me plus two likely-good from the clean first mission and a reasonable new tester in Diana; good balance of safety and information this early.

I wanted to keep Grace/Henry and rotate in two fresh names for more info; this keeps the core but adds only Diana, who was strongly pushing that same line, so I’d rather see a version with someone like Eve/Frank/Jack instead.
I’m on the team and it still leans on the Mission 1 info without fully locking in that original trio, which fits what I argued for earlier.
High chance at least one unknown evil is among Grace/Henry/Bob/Diana, and publicly I’ve been fine leaning on the Mission 1 core, so this is a plausible team to pass that can still fail.
Keeps two from the clean Mission 1 team while rotating in two new players for better info without over-trusting the original trio.

I prefer leveraging the full clean Mission 1 trio (Grace/Henry/Iris) plus one add, rather than swapping Iris out and bringing in two untested players (Bob and Diana) at once, which increases risk without clear upside.
Keeps the likely-good core from Mission 1 while testing two new players; good balance of safety and information this early.
All four look likely good; sending a fully good team risks putting Good up 2-0 with no new suspicion on anyone.

Reasonable info-gathering team: keeps two from the clean Mission 1 (Grace, Henry) without re-locking the entire trio, adds widely discussed Bob plus a new slot (Diana). No strong red flags this early; better to get data than stall.

discussion.content: Given how clean the first mission was, I’d feel safest reusing that core of Grace/Henry/Iris and just adding one more person who’s seemed reasonable so far—maybe Bob or Charlie—unless someone has a strong reason to distrust that group.

I like reusing Grace/Henry/Iris for now since a clean first mission is our best info, but I’d rather add someone who wasn’t so eager to jump on that plan right away than just auto-adding me or Charlie.

I’m okay reusing some of the first mission info, but I’d rather keep Grace/Henry and rotate Iris out this time to test a wider pool—maybe add Bob plus one of Eve/Frank/Jack instead of just repeating the same core.

I’d rather not fully lock in the Grace/Henry/Iris trio yet—keeping two of them and swapping one out (plus adding someone like Bob or Eve) gives us more info without putting all our trust in an untested block.
I’m okay leaning on the Mission 1 info for now, so I’d keep Grace/Henry/Iris together and just add Bob as the fourth—if that block isn’t actually clean, a 4-person mission should expose it quickly.

I don’t think we should fully lock in the Grace/Henry/Iris trio yet just off one clean mission—I'd keep at most two of them and add someone like Bob plus one from {Charlie, Eve, me} so we’re getting more info without giving a potential hidden pair too much control.

I’m generally comfortable reusing our Mission 1 core for now, so I’d lean Grace/Henry/Iris plus Bob as the fourth. If this passes and something goes wrong, we’ll have a much clearer read on that whole block early.

Given Mission 1 was clean, I’m inclined to keep Grace and Iris with me, but I’d rather add Bob than start swapping that core out too aggressively this early. If someone wants to break up the trio, I’d like to hear a concrete reason beyond just “more info.”

I’m on board with reusing the Grace/Henry/Iris core for now since a clean first mission is our best anchor, and adding Bob seems like the most reasonable low-drama extension of that info. If this goes sideways, we’ll learn a lot about all four of us very quickly.

I’m a little wary of locking in the full Grace/Henry/Iris trio again so fast—I'd rather keep two of them, add Bob, and rotate in one new name (I’m fine going myself) so we get more info without betting everything on the same block.

proposals.reasoning: Grace and Henry have been on both missions, including the clean first mission, and are widely trusted as a core. The only clear change on the failed second mission was adding Bob and Diana, so leaving both of them off helps avoid repeating that risk. Iris from Mission 1 is also controversial after that second mission’s result, so excluding her as well keeps this lineup safer. Adding Jack fits with the table’s preference for introducing a fresh face alongside the Grace–Henry core, and this team of Charlie, Grace, Henry, and Jack avoids all of the currently most-suspected players while still aligning with the consensus direction from discussion.

votes.comment: Too likely to be an all-good team built around trusted Grace and Henry, giving evil no reliable way to sabotage this mission.
Grace and Henry are our best clears so far, and swapping out both me and Diana for two fresh faces (Charlie, Jack) is a reasonable way to avoid the last fail and gain new info.
All four players on this team are outside the main suspicion pool and the Grace–Henry core is widely trusted, so this lineup is very likely clean.

As long as I’m off a widely trusted team built around Grace and Henry, it’s too likely to be all- or mostly-good and pushes us toward a clean mission without giving new alignment info on the main suspects.
None of my known evil teammates are on this team, so I’d rather push for a lineup that includes at least one of us to guarantee sabotage potential.

Most of the table wanted the Mission 1 core Grace–Henry–Iris plus Charlie; this team oddly drops Iris, who is actually the cleanest from prior results, for Jack. I’d rather stick to G–H–I + Charlie to maximize both safety and info.
Keeps trusted Grace/Henry core, excludes highly suspicious Bob/Diana, and tests two fresh players for info.
Keeps the likely core (Grace + me) while excluding the main suspects Bob and Diana; Charlie and Jack are fresh and not yet linked to any fail, so this is about as safe as we can get right now.
I wanted to keep the proven Mission 1 core of Grace, Henry, and me plus add Charlie; dropping me for Jack breaks that structure without giving us better info on who caused the Mission 2 fail.
Keeps the main suspects Bob and Diana off, retains the trusted Grace–Henry core, and I know I’m good; including Charlie (Merlin/Morgana to me) is a reasonable risk here.

proposals.reasoning: Grace, Henry, and Iris are the clean Mission 1 core that everyone is most comfortable trusting, and adding Charlie matches the broad consensus to bring in one fresh face while explicitly keeping both Bob and Diana off after the Mission 2 fail. This lineup maximizes the chances of a successful mission and gives us clear information going forward without reintroducing the previous source of suspicion.

votes.comment: Iris is on the team and strongly trusted, so this gives evil a great chance to sabotage while looking like the safest, most consensus lineup.

I know I’m good, so the Mission 2 fail guarantees at least one spy among {Grace, Henry, Diana}. This team includes both Grace and Henry, which likely puts at least one suspected spy on the mission; I’d rather avoid having both of them together and use a lineup that better isolates the source of the earlier fail.
Mission 1 doesn’t actually clear Iris—one spy can easily choose to pass early. Reusing the full M1 trio plus just one new person gives us very little new info and risks carrying a hidden spy forward.
Consistent with my earlier support for the Grace–Henry–Iris core plus Charlie; rejecting now would look suspicious.
Includes my evil teammate Iris on a widely trusted core, giving us a good chance to sabotage while keeping my earlier support for this lineup consistent.

Best available team: it reuses the clean Mission 1 trio (Grace, Henry, Iris) and adds only one new variable (Charlie) while keeping both Bob and Diana—our main suspects from Mission 2—off the mission.
Keeps the clean Mission 1 core (me, Henry, Iris) and adds only Charlie while excluding both Bob and Diana after the Mission 2 fail; safest and most informative option right now.

Keeps the proven-clean Mission 1 core (Grace, Henry, Iris) and adds just one new player (Charlie) while excluding both Bob and Diana after the failed Mission 2, which is our safest and most informative option right now.
This matches the widely supported Mission 1 core plus Charlie that I already endorsed, so rejecting now would look inconsistent and suspicious.
Mission 1’s Grace–Henry–Iris core was clean, and adding Charlie while excluding Bob and Diana best isolates the Mission 2 fail and fits my previously stated preference.

discussion.content: Given that Mission 1 with Grace, Henry, and Iris was clean, while the only change on the failed Mission 2 was adding Bob and Diana, I’d really like to keep Grace and Henry as our core and be very cautious about sending Bob or Diana again. I’d be happiest with a team built around Grace, Henry, and someone from the first mission rather than repeating the Mission 2 setup.

I get why I look suspicious after that fail, but statistically it’s more likely Diana was the added spy than me, so I’d still like to keep Grace and Henry and add Iris plus one of Alice/Charlie rather than auto-excluding me.

I’d stick with Grace and Henry as a core, but instead of recycling the exact same pool, I’d rather see a fresh face or two like me, Eve, or Frank than bringing back both Bob and Diana together. That gives us a better chance to isolate where the Mission 2 fail came from without overcommitting to any early reads.

I’m fine with sticking to the Grace + Henry core and rotating around them, but if we’re trying to pinpoint the Mission 2 fail, I’d much rather see Iris plus someone new like Charlie or Eve than bringing Bob back right away.
I like keeping Grace and Henry as the core, and I’d lean toward adding Iris plus one new face like me or Charlie so we can keep Bob and Diana off for now and see if things stay clean.

I’m on board with keeping Grace and Henry as the core and bringing Iris back, then adding just one new person like Charlie, Eve, or me, while leaving both Bob and Diana off this next team. That gives us the best shot at a clean mission and clearer info on where the fail came from.

I’m definitely most comfortable keeping the Mission 1 core of me, Henry, and Iris, and I’d rather add one new person like Charlie/Eve/Frank than risk bringing Bob or Diana back right after that fail. That should give us the best shot at a clean run and clearer info.
I agree we should stick with the Mission 1 core of Grace, Iris, and me, and for the fourth I’d slightly prefer adding Charlie this time so we get a fresh read without risking Bob or Diana again yet.
I’m with the consensus of keeping the Mission 1 core of Grace, Henry, and me, and for the fourth I’d rather add Charlie this time and keep both Bob and Diana off after that last fail.

Sticking with the Mission 1 core of Grace, Henry, and Iris plus adding Charlie feels like the safest and most informative team right now, especially keeping both Bob and Diana off after the last fail. I’m comfortable approving that lineup.

proposals.reasoning: Most players agree we should bench both Grace and Henry this round after two consecutive fails with that core. There’s also strong consensus around building the team around Bob + Iris, then filling with people who haven’t been on multiple failing missions, particularly from the Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack group. This team follows that logic exactly: Bob and Iris as the core, plus Alice, Eve, and Frank from the commonly suggested pool, while keeping Grace and Henry off and avoiding the Diana/Charlie/Iris-Grace-Henry mixes that have caused suspicion. It gives us a fresh look with a composition that best matches the majority’s stated preferences.

votes.comment: Three of us evil are on this team; passing it all but guarantees we can fail the mission and win.
Bench both Grace and Henry is good, but including Iris (who was on the last fail) is unnecessary risk when we could run Bob + four from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack instead for a cleaner team.
I still don’t trust Iris after the last fail, and putting her together with Alice on a 5‑man feels too risky when we’re already down 1–2.
Team is almost certainly not all-good given deductions from prior missions, and a fail here wins the game for evil while also matching my stated preference to bench Grace/Henry.
Three evils on a 5-person mission 4 team gives us the best chance to stack enough FAILs to end the game.

Benching Grace and Henry after two fails with that core is correct, and this team matches the broad consensus of building around Bob+Iris plus new blood. As a fresh lineup without the main suspicious pair, it’s our best shot right now.

Both fails can be explained by Henry as the single known overlapping suspect; as I know I’m good, Henry must be evil. This team benches both me and Henry and avoids the Grace–Henry core, so it’s currently the safest structure available around Bob+Iris with fresh members.

This keeps both Grace and Henry off after two fails with that core and uses a mostly fresh set of players; Bob and Iris each only appeared on one failing team, and Alice/Eve/Frank haven’t been on any, so this is about as safe as we can get now.
Three of my fellow evils are on this team and both Grace and Henry are benched, giving us an excellent chance to fail the mission.
Matches the broad consensus to bench Grace and Henry after two fails, builds around the commonly trusted Bob+Iris core plus three fresh players, and aligns with the plan I previously advocated.

discussion.content: Given the double-dip on the failed missions, I really don’t want Grace and Henry *both* on the next team—at least one of them has to be dirty. I’d be much more comfortable re-adding Iris from the successful first mission and filling out the rest with people who haven’t shown up on multiple fails.

I’m with Alice that at least one of Grace/Henry is almost certainly evil, so for the next team I’d like to see something like me, Iris, Diana, and two from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack with *neither* Grace nor Henry on it.

I’m not convinced Grace and Henry are the problem here—Mission 2’s single fail could just as easily point at Diana, and Iris being on both a success and a fail doesn’t clear her. I’d rather see something like Bob, Grace, Henry, and two from Eve/Frank/Jack/Charlie, and keep Iris/Diana off this one.

I really don’t want to see both Grace and Henry together again—two straight fails with that core is too much—so I’d rather build around people who’ve only been on one or zero failing teams, like Bob plus a mix of Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack. Iris is a bit of a coin flip for me right now, but I’d rather include her than rerun the Grace–Henry combo.

I’m broadly on board with Bob’s idea of keeping Grace and Henry off the next team; something like Bob, Iris, and two or three from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack feels a lot safer than rerunning the Grace–Henry core again.

Given that both fails shared the Grace–Henry core, I really don’t want either of them on this next team; I’d lean toward something like Bob, Iris, and two or three from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack, with Diana as a maybe but definitely not alongside Grace or Henry.

I get why people are suspicious of the Grace–Henry core, but writing both of us off feels hasty when Diana and Iris each overlap only one fail; I’d be comfortable with something like Bob, me, Iris, and two from Alice/Eve/Frank so we’re not just tunneling on the same pair.

Given that I’ve been on both failing teams alongside Grace, I’m fine with people benching one or both of us this round and instead building around a Bob/Iris core plus folks like Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack. I’d be especially wary of putting Diana and Grace together again before we have clearer info.

I’m very much in the “bench both Grace and Henry this round” camp, and I’d like to see something like Bob, me, and a mix from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack rather than rerunning any of the Grace–Henry cores. If we can agree on Bob + Iris as the base and then argue over which two or three of that newer group to add, I think we’re in the safest spot information‑wise.

I’m strongly in the “bench both Grace and Henry” camp this round, and I’d like to see something like Bob + Iris as the core with three from Alice/Eve/Frank/Jack, keeping Diana and Charlie off for now so we get a totally fresh look.
